sentence.Network_en: It can embolden us by giving names to our fears.
sentence.Network_cn: 它能鼓励我们正视并表达我们的忧惧.

sentence.Network_en: Unfortunately, being able to pay off victims will embolden muggers.
sentence.Network_cn: 不幸的是能补偿受害人将使凶手更大胆.

sentence.Network_en: More political instability would likely embolden Islamic militants to try to expand.
sentence.Network_cn: 政坛的进一步动荡可能会加剧伊斯兰武装分子扩张的野心.

entry.tran: 使有胆量;使有信心;鼓励
entry.def: If you are emboldened by something, it makes you feel confident enough to behave in a particular way.

example.ex: The Prime Minister was steadily emboldened by the discovery that he faced no opposition...
example.tran: 发现自己并未遭到反对，首相渐渐有了信心。

example.ex: Four days of non-stop demonstrations have emboldened the anti-government protesters.
example.tran: 持续4天不间断的示威使反政府抗议者士气高涨。

auth_sentence.content: To embolden her to attempt extorting the right of investitures.
auth_sentence.res_content: To embolden her to attempt extorting the right of investitures.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: To embolden her to attempt extorting the right of investitures.

auth_sentence.content: You embolden one to make daring requests.
auth_sentence.res_content: You embolden one to make daring requests.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You embolden one to make daring requests.

auth_sentence.content: The austerity measures may embolden protesters who have promised a heated fall.
auth_sentence.res_content: The austerity measures may embolden protesters who have promised a heated fall.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The austerity measures may embolden protesters who have promised a heated fall.

sentences.en: His success emboldened him to expand his business.
sentences.cn: 他有了成就因而激发他进一步扩展业务。

sentences.en: This emboldened me to ask for more help.
sentences.cn: 这使我更大胆地开口请求更多的帮助。
